li.For degree-seeking students, certificate: For degree-seeking students, certificates will be awarded only at time of degree completion.

courseSection0.text:
Admission Requirements
None
Certificate Requirements
For degree-seeking students, certificates will be awarded only at time of degree completion.
Prerequisite Courses
None

courseSection1.text0: Students choose one course in each of the following areas:
courseSection1.text1:
Abrahamic Traditions
JST3550 - Introduction to Modern Judaism (3)
REL3320 - Moses, Jesus and Muhammad (3)
REL3363 - Islam (3)
REL3403 - Christianity (3)
courseSection1.text2:
Asian and Indigenous Traditions
ANT3245 - Native American Religions (3)
REL3123 - Asian Religions in America (3)
REL3333 - Hinduism (3)
REL3340 - Buddhism (3)
courseSection1.text3:
Select an upper level REL course not already used above
Earn at least 3 credits from the following types of courses: 
Upper Level REL course not already used above.

Additional but related courses may be substituted if appropriate. Students should contact the certificate advisor to determine suitability.

li.A grade of \"C\" (2.0) or better is requ: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.
li.At least 9 hours used in the certificate: At least 9 hours used in the certificate must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.Independent Study or Co-op credit cannot: Independent Study or Co-op credit cannot be used toward the certificate.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, military credit) may be used.

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements

A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.
At least 9 hours used in the certificate must be earned at UCF within the department.
Independent Study or Co-op credit cannot be used toward the certificate.
No credit by exam (TSD, military credit) may be used.
